articles.author: Elizabeth Piper, Kate Holton
articles.description: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer will try to revive hope for peace in Ukraine at a meeting with Volodymyr Zelenskiy and other Western leaders on Sunday, two days after the Ukrainian leader and U.S. President Donald Trump clashed in Washington.
articles.title: UK's Starmer tries to revive hope for Ukraine peace at summit

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Trump has suggested making Canada the 51st U.S. state.
articles.title: Canada PM Trudeau says protecting independence is his priority in talks with King Charles

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ukraine's Volodymyr Zelenskiy said on Sunday he believed he could salvage his relationship with U.S. President Donald Trump after their explosive meeting in the Oval Office, but that talks needed to continue behind closed doors.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy says he can salvage relationship with US

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said on Sunday that tariffs on Canada and Mexico will go into effect on Tuesday, but that President Donald Trump will determine whether to stick with the planned 25% level.
articles.title: Trump will set exact levels for Mexico, Canada tariffs coming Tuesday, says US commerce chief

articles.author: Emily Rose, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Jaidaa Ahmad
articles.description: Israel said it will adopt the proposal for Ramadan and Passover.
articles.title: Israel blocks aid into Gaza as ceasefire standoff escalates

articles.author: Adam Jourdan, Lisandra Paraguassu, Eduardo Baptista, Michael Martina
articles.description: Argentina's libertarian President Javier Milei came to office in late 2023 slamming China as a communist "assassin" and threatening to weaken ties with the Asian nation. Instead, exports to China including soy and lithium jumped 15% in his first year.
articles.title: China trade surge poses challenge for Trump's South America influence

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Christian Stocker, leader of the conservative Austrian People's Party (OVP), was sworn in as chancellor on Monday, heading the first three-party government since the aftermath of World War Two and keeping the far-right Freedom Party in opposition.
articles.title: Austrian conservative Stocker sworn in as head of coalition government

articles.author: Sonia Rolley, Giulia Paravicini, Ange Kasongo
articles.description: Congolese soldiers in a mix of fatigues and street clothes crowded into a chapel last week to stand trial for crimes including rape and murder allegedly committed as they fled in the face of a lightning rebel advance.
articles.title: Congo army desertion trials spotlight a force in tatters

articles.author: Andrea Shalal
articles.description: A senior official with the U.S. Agency for International Development in an email on Sunday warned that the Trump administration's dismantling of the agency will result in unnecessary deaths -- only to email his staff less than 30 minutes later to say that he had been placed on leave.
articles.title: USAID official warns of unnecessary deaths from Trump's foreign aid block, then says he's been put on leave

articles.author: Lisa Richwine
articles.description: This year's race has featured plenty of twists and turns.
articles.title: Ariana Grande, Selena Gomez arrive at unpredictable Oscars
